qax-os/excelize,163927785,180,make SetCellStyle quicker by skipping conversions in checkCellInArea,‚Ä¶","‚Ä¶ and skipping area checks when we are sure the cell can't be before or past the current row/col
Hi,

I had some performance problems on the XLSX file I was trying to generate. I analysed the time spent in various places and found out that most of the time was spent in SetCellStyle, and that the slowness was caused by checkCellInArea.
I rewrote checkCellInArea. Among the changes:
- avoid all the conversions of cell/row/col that were not needed
- replace the part responsible for extracting the cell's col/row (e.g. ""BC42"" -> col ""BC"" and row ""42"") by not using strings.Map and stopping as soon as a digit is found
I added tests for the new checkCellInArea. I also modified SetCellStyle to skip checks when it's sure that the cell cannot belong to a current col/row being looped on.
I you have any question on my changes, feel free to ask me :).

As an example of the speed bonus that the changes got me, I had to generate an XLSX of 1400+ rows and 7 cols. It went from 1m40s to 3s after the changes. But this example is quite extreme because there was a lot of heavy styling involved in that excel file.",mbresson,1840201,closed,False,2018-01-19T09:58:55+00:00,2023-02-16T08:13:26+00:00,2018-01-19T12:58:26+00:00,2018-01-19T12:58:26+00:00,541d29f3b2bfc62c05813a8d8725fca0a628bc81,unknown,159,18,5,1,0,1,,,size/L
